doc_class_description: A Court of Appeal judgment is a higher court ruling that reviews decisions of lower courts, shaping legal precedent and protecting citizens’ rights.

latest_doc_d.description: Weerasingha Appuhamilage Sujeewa Sampath Weerasingha, Vs Hon. Attorney General before Hon. R.P. Hettiarachchi, J.
latest_doc_d.parties: Weerasingha Appuhamilage Sujeewa Sampath Weerasingha, Vs Hon. Attorney General
latest_doc_d.keywords: Statutory Rape-Aggravating Circumstances-Mitigating factors- Degree of pre-planning by the Appellant- Physical and psychological trauma endured by the victim- Deterrence on the society.
latest_doc_d.legistation: Section 364(2) (e) of the Penal Code as amended by the Act No 22 of 1995. - Section 333(5) of the Code of Criminal Procedure Code Act
